hints.content:
Every bill has a different value.

Dollar name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
One dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/526e9b19f2c39d0d908b6c531d510186f6e93e97.png) | $\$1$
Five dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/5069901d0226c2c5f1c3e73b2b5d7e48ee1e1eee.png) | $\$5$
Ten dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/35b0286a92e1825d39af39b5e362e5d9674eb00d.png) | $\$10$
Twenty dollar bill | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/66f0febd8ba41a0e3413f72b2f1fc2d54a3819de.png) | $\$20$

Let's label the value of each set of bills and find the total.

###$4$ ten dollar bills, $4$ five dollar bills, and $1$ one dollar bill

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}  + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5} + \$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{4}{\text{ five dollar bills}}} + \underbrace{\$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ one dollar bill}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{40}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{20}}_{\purpleD{4}{\text{ five dollar bills}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ one dollar bill}}}=\$61
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$61$, so it is **not** equal to $\$71$.

###$7$ ten dollar bills and $1$ five dollar bill

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10} + \$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{7}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}}  + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}} \\\\
&\underbrace{\$\goldE{70}}_{\goldE{7}{\text{ ten dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\purpleD{5}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ five dollar bill}}} =\$75
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$75$, so it is **not** equal to $\$71$.

###$3$ twenty dollar bills, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $1$ one dollar bill

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20} + \$\maroonD{20}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}}   + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}} +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ one dollar bill}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\$\maroonD{60}}_{\maroonD{3}{\text{ twenty dollar bills}}} 
 + \underbrace{\$\goldE{10}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ ten dollar bill}}}   +\underbrace{\$\blueE{1}}_{\blueE{1}{\text{ one dollar bill}}}=\$71
\end{align}$

This set of bills has a value of $\$71$, so it **is** equal to Laurel's amount of money.

Laurel could have this set of bills:

$3$ twenty dollar bills, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $1$ one dollar bill

question.content:
Laurel has $\$71$.

**Which set of bills could Laurel have?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $4$ ten dollar bills, $4$ five dollar bills, and $1$ one dollar bill
$7$ ten dollar bills and $1$ five dollar bill
$3$ twenty dollar bills, $1$ ten dollar bill, and $1$ one dollar bill
